inclusion.criterion: positive for the HCV antibody and HCV RNA detected
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: medical records show previous positive HCV RNA tests and a positive enzyme immunoassay for anti-HCV-antibodies

inclusion.criterion: patients with abnormal liver function OR a liver biopsy specimen taken in the 6 months prior to study entry showing chronic hepatitis, or liver fibrosis, or liver cihhrosis
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: recent biopsy was negative for hepatocellular carcinoma and was only remarkable for chronic inflammation compatible with a chronic viral hepatitis

inclusion.criterion: have not been previously treated with pegylated-interferon and ribavirin for HCV
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: his abdomen is soft with no ascites or tenderness

exclusion.criterion: with hemochromatosis defined by a pre-existing diagnosis of hemochromatosis or a positive HFE gene mutation or recipients of solid organ transplants
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: there is no evidence of alcoholic liver disease, bleeding from esophageal varices, hemochromatosis, autoimmune hepatitis, or metabolic liver disease

exclusion.criterion: with clinically significant cardiac or cardiovascular abnormalities, organ grafts, systemic infections, clinically significant bleeding disorders, evidence of malignant neoplastic diseases
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: he is an alert male with no acute distress. His BP: 130/75, HR: 90/min and BMI: 27

exclusion.criterion: subjects who are on lipid-lowering medications
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has a history of HCV and recent coinfection with HBV. He is on IFN, RBV and direct antiviral drugs for the past 6 months.
